TITLE: Inquiry-Based Learning
DEF: Learning through guided and independent investigation into complex problems.
TASK: Inquiry-Based Learning promotes curiosity, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills by encouraging students to ask questions, explore, and discover knowledge independently. This pattern fosters a sense of ownership, autonomy, and motivation in learners, while cultivating lifelong learning habits. The pattern supports authentic, real-world learning experiences and student-centered instruction.
